alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 1:29AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Franklin, southern Jefferson and Douglas Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 128 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary ahead of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Perry Lake to near Clinton Lake to 3 miles north of Pomona. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Oskaloosa, Eudora, Wellsville, Centropolis, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Ozawkie, Lecompton, Clinton, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Vinland, Williamstown, Perry Lake, Clinton Lake and Globe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 189 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 189 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
